quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Story and Bible
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, festival, mean. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Christian Nativity scenes are very popular during the Christmas holidays. However, a life-sized Nativity scene is on permanent display in Piazza San Pietro, in this city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Vatican City

questions.question: According to the Bible, this man was the king of Judea, when Jesus Christ was born.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Herod the Great

questions.question: Christmas is believed to have originated from a pagan Roman festival. It lasted 7 days and included the winter solstice, which at that time fell on December 25. Which Roman god did this festival honor?
This is how Santas helper, who judges which children were bad during the year, is called in the Netherlands.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Black Peter

questions.question: Finish this popular Christmas song about Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Join any reindeer games

questions.question: According to the Bible, after Christ was born in Bethlehem, three Magi visited him. They presented Jesus with all these treasures, but one. Can you spot it?
He is the French equivalent of Santa Claus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pere Noel

questions.question: What does to Christmas tree a test mean for students?

options.text: To get a very high score on an exam that you havent studied for
To get a very low score on an exam that you have studied for
To fill in the answer sheet randomly

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: To fill in the answer sheet randomly

questions.question: This ballet tells the story of a Christmas ornament that comes to life in the dream of a young girl. Pyotr Ilyich Tchaikovsky composed the music for it.

options.text: The Nutcracker and the Mouse King

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Nutcracker and the Mouse King

questions.question: The 2004 movie The Polar Express starred this actor in five distinct roles. For example, he was the Boy, the Conductor and even Santa Claus.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Tom Hanks

questions.question: Florida became this number state to enter the union on March 3, 1845.
If you mix milk, eggs and sugar youll get this Christmas drink.

In H. C. Andersens The Little Match Girl, on Christmas Eve, a young girl is wandering through the streets of the snowbound city, trying to sell her matches.  What happens to the little girl at the end of the story?

options.text: She goes back home to celebrate with her father
She dies alone in the snow
She is visited by Santa and given presents
She is invited by a rich family to celebrate the holiday with them

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: She dies alone in the snow

questions.question: A Christmas Carol is a novella, telling us the story of Ebenezer Scrooge, who is visited by the spirits of Christmas Past, Christmas Present and Christmas Yet to Come. Who wrote this famous book?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Charles Dickens

questions.question: At Christmas time radio stations broadcast famous Christmas carols, songs and often, the Hallelujah chorus from the oratorio Messiah, by this composer.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: George Frideric Handel
